page.title: 05RECREATION-RIVER USE
page.content: The river has, in recent years, been made navigable (by use of locks) as far as Stratford on Avon. This has significantly increased the traffic upon the river and narrow boats (and other types of crafts) are frequent visitors in the Summer. A Marina now exists on the Offenham side of Evesham where boats can be hired and repairs undertaken.' The Bridge' at Offenham now caters for these holiday visitors who can be in considerable numbers during the Summer. Fishing has always been a popular sport on the Avon and a local club exists to promote the sport. Many angling clubs from other areas also visit the river in Evesham. The main fish caught are Chub,Perch,Gudgeon and Elvers.
